titles.en: Chapter 35 – The woman of irregular menstruation with the pregnancy
Chapter 35 – The woman of irregular menstruation with the pregnancy

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ الْحَجَّاجِ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا إِبْرَاهِيمَ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِذَا طَلَّقَ الرَّجُلُ امْرَأَتَهُ فَادَّعَتْ حَبَلًا انْتَظَرَ تِسْعَةَ أَشْهُرٍ فَإِنْ وَلَدَتْ وَ إِلَّا اعْتَدَّتْ ثَلَاثَةَ أَشْهُرٍ ثُمَّ قَدْ بَانَتْ مِنْهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, and Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazl Bin Shazaan, altogether from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Abdul Rahman Bin Al Hajjaj who said, 
‘I heard Abu Ibrahim<sup>asws</sup> (7th Imam<sup>asws</sup>) saying: ‘When the man divorces his wife, so she waits while pregnant, she should wait for nine months. So if she were to give birth, or else she should wait three months, then she is irrevocably divorced from him’.

verses.text: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَكِيمٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ الْمَرْأَةُ الشَّابَّةُ الَّتِي تَحِيضُ مِثْلُهَا يُطَلِّقُهَا زَوْجُهَا فَيَرْتَفِعُ طَمْثُهَا كَمْ عِدَّتُهَا قَالَ ثَلَاثَةُ أَشْهُرٍ قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهَا ادَّعَتِ الْحَبَلَ بَعْدَ ثَلَاثَةِ أَشْهُرٍ قَالَ عِدَّتُهَا تِسْعَةُ أَشْهُرٍ قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهَا ادَّعَتِ الْحَبَلَ بَعْدَ تِسْعَةِ أَشْهُرٍ قَالَ إِنَّمَا الْحَبَلُ تِسْعَةُ أَشْهُرٍ قُلْتُ تَزَوَّجُ قَالَ تَحْتَاطُ بِثَلَاثَةِ أَشْهُرٍ قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهَا ادَّعَتْ بَعْدَ ثَلَاثَةِ أَشْهُرٍ قَالَ لَا رِيبَةَ عَلَيْهَا تَزَوَّجُ إِنْ شَاءَتْ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Humeyd Bin Ziyad, from Ibn Sama’at, from Muhammad Bin Abu Hamza, from Muhammad Bin Hakeem, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘A young woman the likes of whom menstruate, her husband divorces her, and her menstruations are lifted. How much is her waiting period?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Three months’. I said, ‘So if she claims to be pregnant after three months?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Her waiting period is nine months’. I said, ‘So if she claims to be pregnant after nine months?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘But rather, the pregnancy is of nine months’. I said, ‘She can marry?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘She should be precautionary for three months’. I said, ‘So if she claimed after three months?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no doubt upon her. She can marry if she so desires to’.

verses.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَنِ ابْنِ حَكِيمٍ عَنْ أَبِي إِبْرَاهِيمَ أَوْ أَبِيهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّهُ قَالَ فِي الْمُطَلَّقَةِ يُطَلِّقُهَا زَوْجُهَا فَتَقُولُ أَنَا حُبْلَى فَتَمْكُثُ سَنَةً قَالَ إِنْ جَاءَتْ بِهِ لِأَكْثَرَ مِنْ سَنَةٍ لَمْ تُصَدَّقْ وَ لَوْ سَاعَةً وَاحِدَةً فِي دَعْوَاهَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moala Bin Muhammad, from Al Hassan Bin Ali, from Aban, from Ibn Hakeem, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ibrahim<sup>asws</sup> (7th Imam<sup>asws</sup>), or from his<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup> having said with regards to the divorced woman, her husband divorces her so she is saying, ‘I am pregnant’. So she remains for a year’, he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘If she comes with him after more than a year, she would not be ratified, even if it is one hour in her claim’.

verses.text:
حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ سَمَاعَةَ وَ أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَكِيمٍ عَنِ الْعَبْدِ الصَّالِحِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ الْمَرْأَةُ الشَّابَّةُ الَّتِي تَحِيضُ مِثْلُهَا يُطَلِّقُهَا زَوْجُهَا فَيَرْتَفِعُ طَمْثُهَا مَا عِدَّتُهَا قَالَ ثَلَاثَةُ أَشْهُرٍ قُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ فَإِنَّهَا تَزَوَّجَتْ بَعْدَ ثَلَاثَةِ أَشْهُرٍ فَتَبَيَّنَ بِهَا بَعْدَ مَا دَخَلَتْ عَلَى زَوْجِهَا أَنَّهَا حَامِلٌ قَالَ هَيْهَاتَ مِنْ ذَلِكَ يَا ابْنَ حَكِيمٍ رَفْعُ الطَّمْثِ ضَرْبَانِ إِمَّا فَسَادٌ مِنْ حَيْضَةٍ فَقَدْ حَلَّ لَهَا الْأَزْوَاجُ وَ لَيْسَ بِحَامِلٍ وَ إِمَّا حَامِلٌ فَهُوَ تَسْتَبِينُ فِي ثَلَاثَةِ أَشْهُرٍ لِأَنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ قَدْ جَعَلَهُ وَقْتاً يَسْتَبِينُ فِيهِ الْحَمْلُ 
قَالَ قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهَا ارْتَابَتْ قَالَ عِدَّتُهَا تِسْعَةُ أَشْهُرٍ قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهَا ارْتَابَتْ بَعْدَ تِسْعَةِ أَشْهُرٍ قَالَ إِنَّمَا الْحَمْلُ تِسْعَةُ أَشْهُرٍ قُلْتُ فَتَزَوَّجُ قَالَ تَحْتَاطُ بِثَلَاثَةِ أَشْهُرٍ قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهَا ارْتَابَتْ بَعْدَ ثَلَاثَةِ أَشْهُرٍ قَالَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهَا رِيبَةٌ تَتَزَوَّجُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Humeyd Bin Ziyad, from Ibn Sama’at, and Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Safwan, from Muhammd Bin Hakeem, 
(It has been narrated) from Al-Abd Al-Salih<sup>asws</sup> (7th Imam<sup>asws</sup>), said, ‘I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The young woman, the likes of whom menstruate, her husband divorces her, so her menstruations are lifted. What is her waiting period?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Three months’. I said, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! Supposing she were to get married after three months, so it is manifested by her after having entered upon her husband, that she is pregnant?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Far be it from that, O Ibn Hakeem! The lifting of the menstruations is of two types – either a spoiling of a menstruation, so the husbands are Permissible for her and she is not pregnant, or if she is pregnant it would have become apparent during three months, because Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic has Made a time during which the pregnancy becomes apparent’. 
He (the narrator) said, ‘I said, ‘Suppose she is of irregular menstruations?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Her waiting period is of nine months’. I said, ‘So if she became irregular after nine months?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said:’ But rather, the pregnancy is of nine months’. I said, ‘So if she were to marry?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘She should be precautionary for three monts’. I said, ‘So if she is irregular after three months?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no doubt upon her. She can get married’.

verses.text:
عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حَكِيمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ أَوْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ رَجُلٌ طَلَّقَ امْرَأَتَهُ فَلَمَّا مَضَتْ ثَلَاثَةُ أَشْهُرٍ ادَّعَتْ حَبَلًا قَالَ يُنْتَظَرُ بِهَا تِسْعَةَ أَشْهُرٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهَا ادَّعَتْ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ حَبَلًا قَالَ هَيْهَاتَ هَيْهَاتَ إِنَّمَا يَرْتَفِعُ الطَّمْثُ مِنْ ضَرْبَيْنِ إِمَّا حَبَلٍ بَيِّنٍ وَ إِمَّا فَسَادٍ مِنَ الطَّمْثِ وَ لَكِنَّهَا تَحْتَاطُ بِثَلَاثَةِ أَشْهُرٍ بَعْدُ 
وَ قَالَ أَيْضاً فِي الَّتِي كَانَتْ تَطْمَثُ ثُمَّ يَرْتَفِعُ طَمْثُهَا سَنَةً كَيْفَ تُطَلَّقُ قَالَ تُطَلَّقُ بِالشُّهُودِ

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Muhammad Bin Sia, from Yunus, from Muhammad Bin Hakeem, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, or Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘A man divorces his wife. So when three months pass by, she claims to be pregnant’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘He should wait with her for nine months’. I said, ‘So if she claim after to be pregnant?’ He<sup>asws</sup> Far be it! Far be it! But rather, the lifting of the menstruation is of two types – Either a pregnancy is manifested, or there is a spoiling from the menstruations. But, she should be precautionary by three months afterwards’. 
And he (the narrator) said as well: ‘Regarding the woman who menstruates, then her menstruation is lifted for a year, how would she be divorced?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘She would be divorced by the witnesses?’
